So, I've likely bitten off more than I can chew within a few weeks for my A=
I class, but it's too late for that now ...

I'm trying to set up a distrib=
uted simulation architecture using a centralized server for managing the po=
pulations that distribute candidate networks to remote hosts to evaluate.  =
Specifically, I plan on using the candidate networks as neural network cont=
rollers for robots within Stage (sans Player).  I'm totally new to HyperNEA=
T, so I'm still figuring out just how to 1) manage the populations and 2) h=
ow to distribute the candidates.  I'm hoping to use the existing Experiment=
 and ExperimentRun classes as examples for 1).  For 2), I'm thinking that I=
 need to somehow take a GeneticIndividual, serialize it for transmission to=
 the client simulation and somehow turn it into the network on the client s=
ide.  Can I get a few newbie pointers on how the process should work?
